overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a practical approach to time-series forecasting under computational constraints, focusing on identifying daily seasonality and using simple averaging as the primary method. The analysis acknowledges data limitations (only 4 days of history) and potential outliers but proceeds with a sophisticated model alternative due to the no-code constraint. The solution emphasizes pattern recognition and data completeness while generating a full 96-hour forecast.
common_data_patterns: Higher values during daytime, lower at night
key_insights: Using hourly averages across multiple days to capture daily seasonality
Rounding forecasts to match input data precision (3 decimals)
Addressing potential outliers through averaging instead of naive repetition
Generating forecasts by repeating the averaged daily pattern for the horizon
Acknowledging limitations in capturing weekly patterns with only 4 days of data
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with detailed pattern analysis and manual calculations, but avoids advanced statistical models due to no-code constraints. Includes data observation, outlier consideration, and step-by-step computation of hourly averages.
